p: “Human activities are changing Earth’s climate,” reads the opening sentence of the American Geophysical Union’s position statement on climate change [ 1]. The same point is central to statements by other science organizations, broad interdisciplinary reviews [ 2], direct surveys of scientists [ 3][ 4], and literature reviews [ 5][ 6]. No major science organization takes a contrary position that human activities are not changing the Earth’s climate [ 7].
